d: A simple, single-piece jacket for a dog or other quadruped

s.biasTapeLength.d: To finish the edge, you will need {{{ l }}} of [bias tape](/docs/sewing/bias-tape)
s.finishWithBiasTape: Finish raw edge with bias tape
s.measurementsWarning: Don't change any of the other fit settings before setting the chest circumference!

chest_circum.d: The measurement around the chest, just behind the elbows. Everything else scales to this, so set it first!

backlength.d: Measurement from the back of the collar to the base of the tail

neck_circum.d: Measurement around the neck at the level of the collar - or just take off and measure the collar

neck_to_chest.d: Measure from the back of the collar to the back of the chest measurement

shouldertoshoulder.d: Horizontal measurement across the back, from the top of one armhole to the other

back_width.d: How wide the jacket should be at the back

neck_overlap.d: How far the neck should overlap itself at the front

bellyoverlap.d: How far the belly should overlap itself at the bottom

back_length_percentage.d: Used to shorten the back of the jacket

bellyclosurelength.d: How long the closure at the bottom should be, relative to total length

neckband_width.d: Width of the neckband, or how far the jacket should come down the chest from the front of the collar

neck_round_edges.d: Round the edges of the neck closure

belly_round_edges.d: Round the edges of the belly closure

armholecurve.d: How wide to carve the armhole

neck_circle_percentage.d: Affects the angle of the neck. 50 is perfect for most dogs, 90 is better for humans

closure_style.none.d: Only mark overlap lines for closures

closure_style.buttons.d: Mark buttons and buttonholes for closures

neck_button_count.d: How many buttons or snaps to place at the neck

belly_button_count.d: How many buttons or snaps to place at the belly

belly_velcro_shrink.d: How much margin the belly velcro should leave on the edges

neck_velcro_shrink.d: How much margin the neck velcro should leave on the edges

pocket_type.d: Whether to generate a pocket, and what kind

pocket_type.kangaroo.d: Generate a hoodie-style kangaroo pocket on the back

pocket_type.cargo.d: Generate two cargo pockets on the back

pocket_depth.d: Depth of the pocket, as a percentage of the back length

pocket_width.d: Width of the pocket, as a percentage of the chest circumference

pocket_vert_offset.d: How far down the back to place the pocket

pocket_horiz_offset.d: How far away from the spine to place the pocket

cargo_pocket_fold.d: How far to pleat the edges of the cargo pocket

cargo_pocket_orientation.d: Which side to place the cargo pocket closure on

cargo_pocket_orientation.vertical.d: The pocket opens towards the front of the jacket

cargo_pocket_orientation.horizontal.d: The pocket opens towards the spine of the jacket

biasTapeLength.d: To finish the edge, you will need {{{ l }}} of [bias tape](/docs/sewing/bias-tape)

measurementsWarning.d: Don't change any of the other fit settings before setting the chest circumference!
